alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 14 at 11:11PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area the Yukon River from the Bridge upstream to Fort Yukon * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Ice jam flooding is expected at Fort Yukon between now and tonight. Impacts could range between minor or major flooding. Ice may also push overbank and move onshore along the river. The possibility of ice jam flooding is expected to move downstream to Beaver on Monday, and to Stevens Village and the Yukon River Bridge on Monday night and Tuesday. If an ice jam forms, water will rise very rapidly and people may need to evacuate to higher ground at a moments notice. Prepare your community now for flooding, and where possible, move items to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Major ice jam flooding occurred at Circle on Saturday. The high water and ice has now moved downstream and is passing through Fort Yukon. When the run of ice and high water reaches the in place ice downstream of Fort Yukon, it is expected to form an ice jam and back water and ice up into Ft Yukon and cause rapid river rises there between now and tonight. The break up front and the possibility of ice jam flooding is expected to move downstream to Beaver on Monday, and to continue moving downstream to Stevens Village and the Yukon River Bridge on Monday night and Tuesday. If an ice jam forms, water will rise very rapidly and inundate low lying areas near the river. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare you community for possible flooding. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River from the Yukon River Bridge upstream to Fort Yukon, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
